Comments_List: I learned about the comprehensive history of the Ancient Andes before the Spanish conquest, focusing on the various cultures, societies, and empires that dominated the landscape up until the Inca. We focused on identifying different periods through textiles, ceramics, and architecture. We were also able to learn about the various archaeologists responsible for many of the advancements in the field (Prof. Burger is definitely one of them!).

The lectures were really interesting and I appreciated the conversations Prof. Burger would have with the class beforehand. Prof. Burger is very approachable, as was the TA. 

The only change I would ask is that the exercises be more spread out (e.g. 1 before the midterm and 1 after, rather than both towards the end of the semester).
Lecture slides aren't posted and sometimes it's hard to catch everything in class.
Yes. This is a great chance to learn about the Pre-Columbian cultures of Peru, and will give you a semester-long window into a fascinating field of study.
